title: Southwest Community Associates: Women Artists of the Art Institute of Chicago's Collection
hero_caption: Wanda Pimentel. Involvement Series, 1968. Through prior purchase from the Mary and Leigh Block Fund.
description:
Margaret Farr will examine the creativity of women artists in the Art Institute's permanent collection, from the 18th- century pastellist Rosalba Carriera through the contemporary works of Judy Ledgerwood, Cindy Sherman, and Wanda Pimentel.

Schedule of the Day:
Transportation on your own

11:30 Lunch at Uptown Grill

12:30 Lecture

Speaker: Margaret Farr

Registration Period: January 31, 2019–February 14, 2019

To contact the event planners, please reach out to Deborah M Torri at debroadway3@aol.com or (815) 830-3486, or reach out to Barbara Mueller at bmuellwe51@yahoo.com.

This Community Associates event is exclusively for current Community Associates members. Membership will be verified at the door, and refunds cannot be issued for those without a valid membership. For Community Associates events that allow guests, nonmember guests must be registered by a Community Associates member.

If you are interested in becoming a member of Community Associates, please visit artic.edu/joinnow to join both the Art Institute of Chicago and the Community Associates group of your choice.
location: Uptown Grill, 601 First Street, LaSalle, IL 61301
buy_button_caption:
Registration period: January 31, 2019–February 14, 2019

$50 per person, open to Community Associates members and their guests
